<notnotstorm_p> re: **@FunnyGiulio**
> 1s is possible with a LOT of work but it might be potentially unnecessary. The lower you go, the more exponentially difficult decreasing the slot time is and returns get exponentially lower
for human interfaces there are huge diminishing returns once you approach 100-200ms. but before that can make the difference between something feeling interactive or not

for MEV many forms of MEV scale as sqtr(slot_time) so 1s would cut the value extraction by 2.4x compared to 6s

for interop lower slot times will make the L1+L2 feel like one unified chain because L1<-->L2 interop will become lower friction. also any use cases taht use L1 as message bus between L2's

lowering the slot time will definitely be labor intensive but I don't think we're anywhere near diminishing returns and so I don't think anyone can say with certainty where the diminishing returns will start to really kick in
